definition: to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)

sentences.english: We hope to present a plan to the MOE by the end of September.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望於九月底能將計畫書呈報教育部。

sentences.english: Menelaus has told us that you wish to return to your homes and occupations.
sentences.chinese: 默乃勞向我們呈報，說你們願意回鄉，從事己業。

sentences.english: Applicators should submitted the operation plan and related certificates.
sentences.chinese: 申請者向公司呈報有關證明文件與經營計劃書。

sentences.english: Vietnam has reported 93 of those, with 42 deaths.
sentences.chinese: 越南已呈報了93例，死亡人數爲42人。

sentences.english: You can direct report to the senior colonel.
sentences.chinese: 你都可以直接呈報大隊長。

sentences.english: Food poisoning is a notifiable disease in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 食物中毒是一個須呈報的疾病，在英國。

sentences.english: In may , the number of notifications of bacillary dysentery was 5
sentences.chinese: 五月份，桿菌痢疾的呈報個案有5宗。

sentences.english: For months january - march , the number of notifications of leprosy was 0
sentences.chinese: 一月至三月份，麻風的呈報個案有0宗。

sentences.english: The report was submitted to the commission for its consideration.
sentences.chinese: 這份報告已呈報委員會審批。

sentences.english: The functional and presentation currency of La Chapelle at consolidation level is RMB.
sentences.chinese: 拉夏貝爾在合併層面的功能和呈報貨幣是人民幣。

definition: financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
